page.title: 17SONGERS COTTAGE
page.content:
Songers Cottage.
Songers, one of the oldest cottages in England, is 750 years old, and grade one listed. Although Mrs and Mr Arther have lived there for 4 years, they have only asked permission to put 2 chimney pots on the roof. The structure is mainly beams, with a Wattle and Daub coat. Outside, the walls are white, and the roof is plain thatched. The windows are leaded light and small, so not allowing much light to enter the rooms. The cottage is in quite good condition, considering its age, and shows no signs of needing to be restored. The gardens are well laid out, and cover about 1 acre of land, half of which is rough pasture.
